name: Wreckfest
description:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Wreckfest and run it.


Servername: 'Wreckfest Docker' Password: 'Docker'

ATTENTION: First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!

Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.

You can also run multiple servers with only one SteamCMD directory!

ports.name: UDP - Game Port
ports.description: UDP Game Port (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change your server settings)

ports.name: UDP - Steam/Query Ports
ports.description: UDP Steam/Query Ports (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change your server settings)

ports.name: TCP - WebConsole
ports.description: WebConsole (by default, you can connect to the Wreckfest console by opening your browser and go to HOSTIP:9028 - eg: 192.168.1.1:9028 - or click on WebUI on the Docker page within Unraid).

variables.name: GAME_ID
variables.description:
The GAME_ID that the container download at startup.
(https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List)

variables.name: GAME_PARAMS
variables.description: Enter your start up commands for the server.

variables.name: Validate Installation
variables.description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

variables.name: Steam-Username
variables.description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

variables.name: Steam-Password
variables.description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).
